revised_title: Observations of the Solar Eclipse and its Effects on the Environment and Animal Kingdom
tldr: This article discusses the observations made during the Great Solar Eclipse of 15th March 1858, focusing on the effects of the eclipse on the weather and the behavior of animals. The author, Edward Joseph Lowe, reports on the changes in temperature, cloud cover, and wind patterns, as well as the reactions of various animal species to the eclipse. The study provides insights into the relationship between the sun, the atmosphere, and living organisms.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Meteorology and Atmospheric Phenomena
